cab.content: ill(This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty's Government.)Operations. SECRET.Prom :- General Delme Radcliffe, Italy. To C.I.G.S., War Office.17.11.17,Handed in at 1.40 a.m. Received at 5.15 a.m.707. Nov. 16th.Situation this evening.During to-day over 800 prisoners have been taken by the Italians at various points of the front, 3rd Army. Small hostile parties attempted to cross Piave at Folina and were repulsed.About 200 prisoners were captured at San Bartolomeo. 4th Army. Two attempts were made by the enemy on the night of Nov. 15th to cross Piave between Fener and Pederobba, Both were repulsed. At dawn steel boats and a footbridge used by the enemy were destroyed by artillery.18th Corps as a result of yesterday's fighting at Prassolan have been withdrawn to Monte Pertica.Monte Fontana - Secca is still held.Nothing of importance on fronts of 1st Army and 3rd Army Corps.
